Key Match Events: Kerry Carpenter matched a career high with four hits.
Trey Sweeney hit a three-run home run in the first inning.
Spencer Torkelson hit an RBI-single in the first inning.
Riley Greene hit a home run in the first inning.
Ezequiel Tovar drove in two runs in the fifth inning.
Ryan McMahon hit a home run in the second inning.
Brenton Doyle hit an RBI single in the fifth inning.
Post-Match Reflections: Kerry Carpenter expressed awareness of needing a homer for the cycle but ended up with an infield single.
Tigers manager A.J. Hinch praised Tyler Holton's performance.
Rockies manager Bud Black commented on Tanner Gordon's learning experience as a rookie.
Tyler Holton reflected on the excitement of the current season compared to the previous year.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Tigers are three games behind Minnesota for the last American League wild card.
The Tigers improved to 20-8 since August 11.
The Tigers finished second in the AL Central in 2023 but missed the wild-card race.
Tanner Gordon allowed seven runs and 10 hits in 3 1/3 innings.
Tyler Holton, Will Vest, and Jason Foley combined for 4 1/3 shutout innings.
Tigers' Reese Olson is expected to throw a bullpen session to determine the next steps in his recovery.
Shortstop Javier Báez, who underwent season-ending hip surgery, used a cane to walk to the outfield for a team picture.
